intro: Coulteria cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban coulteria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
